907460832399609906.name: 💙Flizzless☠#9605
907460832399609906.content:
It was one of the main reasons I started gaming, and one of the main reasons I'm still gaming. Its absolutely incredible how far this game has come and how DDNA even cared to put it on Steam so we can relive all those amazing memories with all our new friends. 
Its more than a game to me
Its a priceless gift 
Thank you DDNA 💙

312092056661000193.name: more3118#5055
312092056661000193.content:
Castle Miner Z was an awesome game. I remember hiding under the ground under the surface cause i was too afraid to get out during the night. Had a lot of fun playing with friends while traveling to Hell. Luckily I still have it on my xbox360 and i do play it time to time for nostalgia. Wish there was a time machine to go back to the old days... 

Thank you DDNA for making such an exciting game!

853029110879223859.name: Ducktober M.#5186
853029110879223859.content:
Dear DDNA, 

 Now... I know this sounds cliché and all, but truly, this is a moment in life that I’ll never forget.  

Castleminer Z was an important part of my childhood. For me, life wasn’t as easy for me as usual. I’d get bullied alot, and I was pretty socially awkward. However, the games you make have made me emotional alot better.
I was a person who somewhat missed out on the popular games like Call of Duty, GTA, and more games that would take forever to mention. I’m was a kid who’d accidentally get the more obscure games. Castleminer Z was probably the first indie game I ever played. When I first got Castleminer Z, I was pretty scared of the game. Zombies, guns, and violence, I wasn’t ready to play the game. But then, as a tried playing it, I soon began to love it. 
Castleminer Z was one of the few games where I’d actually make friends with people, and honestly made me feel relaxed and relieved. Yeah, I was still socially awkward, but I just try to be patient with people. And honestly, I felt like a get to laugh, smile, and feel happy more in real life after playing that game. 
It was great therapy to me, and I just can’t thank you enough for your work. 

       - Ducktober M.

584556857188679680.name: butterized#7198
584556857188679680.content: CMZ was the best $4 ive ever spent

619092330778984468.name: Local#1130
619092330778984468.content: I renember playing cmz on my old pc i had so much fun, sadly i dont have it anymore, but i still hope a sequel will be there for it to get revived😁

654480252869017611.name: My Truth#1665
654480252869017611.content: DDNA, I wish Death Toll wouldn’t have failed as badly as it did. It had so much time and effort put in to it and got overlooked because of Fortnite and PubG. I wish you could somehow get everything back and make more indie games like CMZ that impacted my childhood. One thing I wish you guys hadn’t done is make the NFT’s, it was a bad move.

394930827605049344.name: Neol#4747
394930827605049344.content: I've played Digital DNA games such as CMZ, CMW, Avatar Warfare, CM, Avatar Laser Wars 2 and Avatar Paintball. I will never forget any of these great games. The memories I have of coming home from a long school day and grabbing my $10 Turtle Beach headphones, sitting down on a beanbag and being indecisive of what XB360 indie games to play. Your games have impacted my life in a major way. I remember getting to "Miners Heaven" as we'd call it on CMZ and mining up alien goo and diamonds, creating XP farming maps on CMW, running around rambo with laser guns in ALW2 and splattering my old friends with paintballs in AP. I wish for you to return and port the other games you developed and potentially make long awaited sequels to your fantastic works.

739814136929583175.name: Spartanzarevac#3514
739814136929583175.content: I started playing CMZ when I was 4, it changed my life for good i allways played it on my 360 but after a long long time it to died, then i started playing it on my laptop and it was so diffrent but fresh to because it had a bit more content, overall thank you DDNA for changing my life for good. :)

135881210181320705.name: EpikIzCool#7329
135881210181320705.content: thanks for the game digitial dna i had emailed you a few times awhile ago but i do care about cmz. although if cmz 2 comes out i have some ideas. but again thanks for the amazing memories and gameplay

371983164840607755.content: While i didn't play much their games, it impacted my childhood, when discovered castle miner z on my friends Xbox i stayed playing all night, such a fun game, when i got home i started watching videos about it, it was the game i wanted to own but i couldnt, still i watched all the videos i could and it was the best part of my childhood

917864450164404225.name: bolt#2565

545944271673491508.name: Cast1eMin3rM_2#2444
545944271673491508.content:
When I was younger (around 2012), I used to play CMZ a lot. I miss the days in which I used to have my friends come over to watch me play and then join the server on their own xbox, then spend hours having fun. Sadly I lost it in 2017. 

I'd love to have those days again, whether it be with new or old friends. Thank you DigitalDNA, for making, in my honest to God opinion, the best Minecraft replica ever.

196930219393810432.name: Skyshadow#8535
196930219393810432.content: As soon as i Saw this Game, i couldn't stop watching videos about It, so i bought It. This Game is great and has great potential. A friend and I have played a lot and we have had a lot of fun doing It. This Game is just wonderful and im always looking to play It :)

456226577798135808.name: Deleted User#0000
456226577798135808.content: I loved castle miner z a lot on the 360, and the game is very fun, keep doing what your doing!

235795162314309633.name: Kaine#5407
235795162314309633.content:
While basic looking or with some silly appeals of realistic textures on a blocky landscape, I can't help but love the game for how charming it can be for what it is, a fun, minecraft-esque shooter/survival game of which I enjoyed both solo and with friends for hours on the 360, I'd be more than happy to see it come back on Xbox One or PS4 someday, some way to be able to play it again on a newer-generation console.

Many thanks to DigitalDNA for such a fun little zombie induced indie title, with a thriving community of which I didn't expect, I'll never forget about it no matter what happens. 💝<:CMZ:770336335147827240>

333583560076427264.name: storrim#5055

789320263724433459.name: StellarTheAlienDeer#4350
789320263724433459.content: I played this game on 360 and still play it today on pc I love and hope the best for this game it’s brought me amazing memories and horrors thank you so much. Stellar

239399605274542080.name: Cartoonish Villain#0001
239399605274542080.content: I remember playing the original castle miner before Minecraft came out on the 360. That’s what made my early childhood days man, playing with my friends on that strange, but charming creative mode ordeal. Then when we found castleminer Z the group and I fell in love all over again with it. Even when Minecraft did officially come out we still returned to the game somewhat regularly because it just had a different level of charm. Thank you for the great memories over the years. -jedijoe/Cartoonish Villain

256101359890202624.name: SyntaxError4004#4933

701904198291161116.name: Rumbo#5035
701904198291161116.content: I Remember when I was younger I used to watch my uncle Play a lot of games I remember him playing this  game I was afraid of it for some reason ( I only played games like banjo- kazooie, super Mario). but after years I had remembered that I was afraid of this game I asked my uncle what the name of that game was he told me and I got curious I looked it up on YouTube and found someone playing it it looked really fun after I asked him if he could port it into my 360 and I started playing I did really enjoy the heck out of it and my little sister enjoys it too. After 2 years I got a computer and found steam I already knew about it and I wanted to get into computer games. Then I found the game that gave me all those memories Castle Miner Z. It’s different but it’s practically the same. Thank you Digital Dna.  Sincerely INV4D3R_ZIM

709258635058085890.name: Müder Traümer#9410
709258635058085890.content:
I remember when CMZ was a competitor to minecraft when minecraft came out on the 360, i always loved the game and kept playing it

Even after i lost my 360, i always wanted to return to it, not that long ago i got a laptop and the first thing I did was buy castleminer z to relieve the memories and see if it was as fun as I remembered

It was even more fun that I thought it was going to be, I will forever and ever live CMZ and will forever hope it gets updated or rebooted again
-Fahed

406311264923418646.name: BlackHood#7193
406311264923418646.content: CMZ has way more potential to become a bigger game. With many updates from the devs and the community, this game could be huge. I really want this game to not be forgotten. I was sad I never got to play it on the days of the Xbox 360. I try to do everything I can to promote the game and get others to play it. I really hope it happens. I made friends with this great community here, and we're working together on as much ideas to make CMZ big again.

677180119428628484.name: Raz#4146
677180119428628484.content:
Reposting, old account got false reported and turned into a deleted user.

I really don't know how to start this, but here it goes.
I started playing when i was 5 (2012, i'm 13 now) and since then i've made multiple friends just playing the game on my 360. So many memories have been made playing the game, like the old "space stations" I used to make at the orelands. Without CMZ I probably wouldn't have my 360 still, and I would've never known about how big this community is. DDNA, Thank you so much for giving me all of the time I spent messing around in CMZ with my friends in 2012-2016. It was really worth the money.

281896139366596619.name: ThatWeirdGuyJason#3073
281896139366596619.content: Castle miner z is no where near perfect but in the strangest ways it’s such a creative game that works so well. It’s really fun and I genuinely think a better game with the same game rules would be so good. And as always this community is amazing so thanks DDNA for making it possible

644306055387414548.name: Davy Jones#6020
644306055387414548.content:
Ok I’m going to post a serious response,

Castle miner Z on the Xbox 360 was the only reason I’m still in contact with most of my best friends today, I met them all on that game, and we’ve not stopped talking for the past few years now. This game was genuinely just fun to play, even solo. I just wanted to thank the team over at digital DNA for helping everyone here gain lifelong friends, childhoods, and more. I hope everything ahead is just a smooth road for all of you.

588551638185279498.name: Vɪᴘᴇʀ#1126
588551638185279498.content:
The game was common but different at the same time, it was fun, creative and a challenge 
This was one of the games I play growing up as a child and help me meet one of my best friends I still talk to today, it’s been years since me and my friend logged onto the Xbox 360 and played your game but beings we remember we will take a nostalgia trip together, we have known one another for 8 whole years 

DigitalDNA I will wish you, Thomas Stone. The best regards and happiness for your life’s, you have gave me plenty of memories meeting people, surviving, playing and just having a good time and I can’t thank you enough for the childhood memories you have gave me.


Thank you. DigitalDNA.
Goodluck with the future.

-Vɪᴘᴇʀ#1126

236169065339682819.name: Redemption#5079
236169065339682819.content: I had alot of fun on this game back in the day. Honestly think it could have been better than minecraft had it kept getting updated and had more blocks/better enemies. Will always remember this game.

436566969412485122.name: austria#0286
436566969412485122.content:
CMZ, in my summary.

- Spent countless hours playing it on Xbox 360 back in early 2014, invited some Xbox Live friends and randoms to play with, at the time all the other games I used to play such as Roblox, GTA V, Skyrim and TF2, I remember just giving them the fat L and dedicating my time into playing CMZ, and honestly, I don't regret it, due to the memories made, I first found out about CMZ via YouTube videos in 2013 but didn't get the game till 2014 as I said, and the last time I played it was 2016 somewhere around February, just because I kinda lost interest in Xbox 360 and switched to PC, recently in December 2021 I started rewatching those old videos and rediscovering CMZ, which caused me joining this server.

Now to my final wish for this game, is a sequel and that this incredible community doesn't ever die.

Austro.

398378156530335747.name: Blaziken#0823
398378156530335747.content: I’ll be honest I completely forgot about the games existence until just recently I remembered it and I started playing again with like 3 other friends. It’s definitely a fun game . Not a lot of games like it. Would love to see some updates or maybe even a cmz 2.

508242663535935508.name: Clown#1160
508242663535935508.content: Thank you for making my favorite indie game, ever, on any platform

529381965804077067.name: Parzival#1259
529381965804077067.content: CMZ was a large part of my childhood, I'd come home from school and hop on CMZ with my family. We at one point set up two Xbox 360s so me and my brother could play together. CMZ was always so much fun, and I'm glad to be a part of the community

833560126521737307.name: cannis#1666
833560126521737307.content: CMZ was absolutely insane and i’d love to see it continued. To this day minecraft gun mods are non existant on the xbox platform and they’re difficult to install and run. CMZ game to this day is a hallmark in what should’ve been able to be done in minecraft and its a shame we still dont see that happening. Ive definitely gotta reinstall CMZ on pc someday somehow

512412098035449866.name: Snufflycomic39#4850
512412098035449866.content:
CastleminerZ was a game that had everything i loved when I was younger 
It had minecraft
Guns
And also cool enemies 
It also gave me a game that i could play with my brother that we both really enjoyed. And when I saw that there was a steam version and also that it was more updated than the 360 version me and my brother were so happy and excited to play it again.

I also remember playing laser wars and castleminer no z 

But specifically cmz brought me so much joy when I was younger and i still go back to it every now and then because it's a game that is truly special and I would love to see it go further and become a better game

386498837541552129.name: Beanz#5660
386498837541552129.content:
Castleminer Z has personally brought me a lot of joy, between me and my friends
I cannot thank DigitalDNA enough for not only making this game but also making my childhood

i remember first beating Dragon endurance with my best friend, we felt so happy, ill never forget that moment.

From the bottom of my heart, i want to thank you DigitalDNA for making my live so much better with Castleminer Z and your other works, I look forward to seeing what you have to offer in the future <3

604449069515014185.name: The Rookie#7367
604449069515014185.content: CZM for me was probably some of the best fun I ever had on my Xbox. I ownd the original and Z so me and my step brothers would take turns preparing for hours making forts in Creative with no enemies. Then we would flip it back and battle All the enemies in our fort. I remember spending hours customizing my Xbox Avatar just for CMZ. Its a great game and I will continue to enjoy my time with it.

464899906755100693.name: Matt/x Freeshot#7920
464899906755100693.content: Ddna indie games were the shit, countless hours in cmz, avatar laser wars, farms, you name it. Childhood!

500718188036620320.name: Miner White#8474

Damn dude cmz was my first Minecraft clone I ever played in my life probably the best one I was young when I saw it.. best shooter/builder it was always called Minecraft with guns lol love your games DigitalDNA

404143081173155853.name: Techhy#2765
404143081173155853.content: CMZ was, (for me,) the game to end all games, endless fun, insane fun. I could never top that game, i spend hundreds of hours on CMZ just building and Surviving. DigitalDNA, i CANT THANK YOU ENOUGH.

206197298080776192.name: Gensubaru#6440
206197298080776192.content:
DDNA, if you're reading any of this, which I hope, read well.

Your game was one of the best, if not the most played indie game on the 360 back then, because it actually meant something to us, and ever since 1.6.4, you brought us more fun by introducing the laser weapons, grenades, and many more, and then you continued that unto the PC, with slightly more stuff, until you disappeared for a while.

The only reason this server exists is because we all don't want the fun to end for this game, because it has so much potential, even today! And we're trying our best to do what we can to make it fun until a miracle happens so that we can fully develop our potential into making this game better, and fun for everyone.

We hope it isn't too much to ask, but we only hope is that you'll help us achieve something and expand than what we currently are right know. Because this isn't just a memory to us, it's something that keeps us here in this very server today.

290299339996135424.name: THELIZARD#4377
290299339996135424.content: CMZ was such a staple piece of growing up with my xbox 360. I remember having so much fun on there with my friends-- it's truly a work of art and the ost is amazing. I still have my 360 and really only go back on it to play CMZ. So much good shit came from this game ❤️

556969613754236938.name: Vonoxy#4437
556969613754236938.content: this game is literally the best. so many memories made. hope to make more moving foward. ik im not letting the game go any time soon. ❤️

213760518677069825.name: ReiHowls#3621
213760518677069825.content: I've been playing CMZ since 2012 (not so much now). I would always play on creative (don't ask why) and I had a world where I built a lot of great things and I always remembered travelling on a difficulty and seeing how far I would get which would usually be Hell on earth and not much farther. I remember getting hyped over killing the undead dragon which I would love to do on actual endurance mode, which I've never gave a shot. I guess, thanks for the awesome memories

147613680425631744.name: MistaCat#1936
147613680425631744.content: Been playing CMZ for literal years since the release on the 360. Would be really nice to have an ultimate edition type port for pc and select consoles with improved net play and mechanics. We don't live in the cave ages of bad game engines anymore. Theres still potential for lots of improvements.

134677099033264129.name: Lecher Of Billiam#6955
134677099033264129.content: i remember my friends flexing on me with a bloodstone pickaxe, and my friend Ethan who always used a shotgun, even on dragons....and since it could not shoot far enough i did all the work.

336571493687230474.name: DarkZeRude#9465
336571493687230474.content: I have some memories of playing cmz in the 360 when i was 4 thank you for the game and all and i hope you get better

194448773592645632.name: Frookey#6628
194448773592645632.content: Have a lot of fond memories screwing about in CMZ when I was a lil' tyke. Played the game daily for a large portion of my junior high years. It may not be perfect, or backed by a triple-A budget, but damn if it wasn't some of the best fun I've ever had with the Indi Marketplace. Thank you.

449710278012174346.name: SoldierSoldier1#3079
449710278012174346.content:
CMZ was a huge part of my childhood, not because of the fact that I met friends on Xbox 360 that I would know even until today, but because it introduced me to online gaming as a whole - 11 year old me had no idea there was even online play in the first place. I met other kids from around the world, and was so amazed that this was a thing. Something we all take for granted :)

Thank you DigitalDNA, to you it may have just been an indie game, the culmination of all your other games, combined into the best game you could make at the time, but to me, and a lot of others, it was a discovery, a childhood, a new world. <3

456245825090355203.name: quincy#7369
456245825090355203.content: CastelminerZ was an absolutely huge part of my early life, I played it non-stop and made some great friends. It also encouraged me to change my username, from a pregenerated “moody duchess” to “CASTELmInErZ56”, with the misspelling and everything.

418576340829339648.name: SneakyBox#5605
418576340829339648.content: I gotta say, thank you for all the great and fond memories you gave us.

357875999737774080.name: Brendini#0001
357875999737774080.content: CMZ was my jam when I was like 11 and to this day I find myself playing the game. So thanks for that.

210848753802805249.name: Bartley#3992
210848753802805249.content: This is a temporary channel. No pinging, just say nice things for DDNA to read. I can start by saying CastleMiner Z was a big part of my early teenage years and I made a lot of memories over the Avatar Laser War and other classic DDNA games.
